title: Population of regions in England in 2018
summary: This is a bar chart representing Region in the x axis and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in the y axis.
The maximum Number of inhabitants (in millions) 9.13 is found at Region South East and the minimum is found at North East where Region is 2.66.
The difference of Number of inhabitants (in millions) between the highest and lowest Region is 6.47.
min_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in each Region on the y axis.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is appeared to be the highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Region in the x axis and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in the y axis.
The maximum Number of inhabitants (in millions) 9.13 is found at Region South East and the minimum is found at North East where Region is 2.66.
The difference of Number of inhabitants (in millions) between the highest and lowest Region is 6.47.
max_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in each Region on the y axis.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is appeared to be the highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
There is a difference of 6.47 between the maximum Region South East and minimum Region North East.
Region South East is higher than any other Regions with value 9.13, followed by London, and North West. Down to Region North East with the lowest value 2.66.
The Region South East has 1.47 times more Number of inhabitants (in millions) than average.
Summing up the values of all Regions, we get total 55.92.
